intro: Limonium creticum, commonly known as the Cretan sea lavender, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its flowers bloom in summer, adding a splash of color to coastal landscapes. Limonium creticum is often used in floral arrangements due to its long-lasting blooms and unique appearance.
